title: Which will melt faster, an ice cube or crushed ice? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is an open ended question. Are we talking in sunlight, in the freezer? Suppose in sunlight then the crushed ice with much more surface area and cloudy surface would melt completely first. The cube with less surface area and more light transmittance from being clear would melt more slowly. This also assumes the crushed is spread out and not crushed but left in a cube shape, for that would introduce a change in variables. Have you ever been drinking a soda with the cup mostly full of ice (McDonalds, I’m looking at you) and gotten a freezer burn headache? I have not. Try the same with a slushy and get a completely different reaction. The liquid loses heat more quickly to the crushed ice in the slushy while the soda loses heat more slowly to the hollow ice cubes. This seems irrespective of cup size, but of course the ratio of ice to drink could be different.

I'm not exactly sure but I think crushed ice does.
